net.edzard.kinetic

Class Kinetic

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.edzard.kinetic.Kinetic

  • public class Kinetic
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory class for creating Kinetic objects. Use methods from this class to create Kinetic objects. This class has some default settings that can be overridden. Once overriden, all subsequently created objects will use the new defaults.
    Author:
    Ed

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        public static java.lang.String getVersion()

      • createNode

        public static final Node createNode(java.lang.String json)
        Create a node with JSON string. De-serialization does not generate custom shape drawing functions, images, or event handlers (this would make the serialized object huge). If your app uses custom shapes, images, and event handlers (it probably does), then you need to select the appropriate shapes after loading the stage and set these properties via on(), setDrawFunc(), and setImage() methods

      • createStage

        public static Stage createStage(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element stageContainer)
        Create a new stage object.
        Parameters:
        stageContainer - The DOM element that Kinetic should use
        Returns:
        A stage object.
        See Also:
        Stage

      • createStage

        public static final Node createStage(java.lang.String json,
               com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element stageContainer)
        Create a stage with JSON string. De-serialization does not generate custom shape drawing functions, images, or event handlers (this would make the serialized object huge). If your app uses custom shapes, images, and event handlers (it probably does), then you need to select the appropriate shapes after loading the stage and set these properties via on(), setDrawFunc(), and setImage() methods

      • createTextPath

        public static TextPath createTextPath(Vector2d position,
                      java.lang.String aText,
                      java.lang.String d)
        Create a text shape that follows a SVG path. A SVG path string is made up from path commands (see W3C SVG 1.1 TR).
        Parameters:
        position - The initial position
        aText - The text
        d - The SVG path string
        Returns:
        A text path shape
        See Also:
        PathSVG

      • createLine

        public static Line createLine(Vector2d start,
              Vector2d end)
        Create a line shape. The line will consist of only two points. Use Line#setPoints(List) to set more than two.
        Parameters:
        start - The start point
        end - The end point
        Returns:
        A line object
        See Also:
        Line

      • createLine

        Parameters:
        points -
        Returns:
        A line object
        See Also:
        Line

      • createPolygon

        public static Line createPolygon(Vector2d a,
                 Vector2d b,
                 Vector2d c)
        Create a polygonal shape. The created polygon will be a triangle. Use Polygon.setPoints(List) to set different shape points.
        Parameters:
        a - First point
        b - Second point
        c - Third point
        Returns:
        A triangular polagon shape
        See Also:
        Polygon

        s - The number of sides

      • createPathSVG

        public static PathSVG createPathSVG(Vector2d position,
                    java.lang.String d)
        Create a shape that is defined by a SVG path string. A SVG path string is made up from path commands (see W3C SVG 1.1 TR).
        Parameters:
        position - The initial position
        d - The SVG path string
        Returns:
        A SVG path shape
        See Also:

      • createCustomShape

        public static CustomShape createCustomShape(Vector2d position)
        Create a custom shape. Custom shapes are defined using Path objects.
        Parameters:
        position - The initial position
        Returns:
        An undefined custom shape. A path still has to be set.
        See Also:

      • createAnimation

                        Drawable fct)
        Create an Animation.
        Parameters:
        context - The context layer (animation takes place on this layer)
        fct - A custom drawing function
        Returns:
        An object that can be used to control the animation
